name: Persistent Triggers & Locks (HUGE)
description: A massive package emphasizing persistent static effects and triggered abilities across creatures, artifacts, and enchantments, including Winter Orb-style locks and popular resource engines like Treasure/Clue/Food/Powerstone.

Creature: Whenever this creature ou draw a card, create a treasure token.
Whenever this creature  nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, create a clue token.
Artifacts and enchantments you control have hexproof.
Whenever this enters the battlefield or attacks, tap up to one target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, tap target permanent that player controls.
Enchantment: Whenever you draw a card, create a Treasure token.
Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, create a Clue token.
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Artifacts and enchantments you control have hexproof.
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Artifacts and enchantments you control have hexproof.
Whenever a creature you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless its controller pays {1}.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
Each opponent can't cast more than one noncreature spell each turn.
Spells your opponents cast during your turn cost {2} more to cast.
Whenever a creature an opponent controls attacks, you gain 1 life.
Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0.
Opponents can't untap more than one nonland permanent during their untap steps.
Spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player sacrifices a nonland permanent.

Creatures enter the battlefield tapped.
Nonbasic lands enter the battlefield tapped.
Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.
Each opponent's first spell each turn costs {X} more to cast.
Players can't untap more than one land during their controllers' untap steps.
Players can't gain life.
Players can't search libraries.
Players can't sacrifice permanents.
As long as this is untapped, creatures can't attack.
Whenever a permanent becomes untapped, its controller loses 1 life.
If a player would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, that player mills a card instead.
AuraCreature: Enchanted creature gets +{X}/+{X} and has vigilance.
Enchanted creature has lifelink and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, create a Treasure token."
Enchanted creature has "Whenever this creature attacks, tap up to one target creature defending player controls. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step."
Equipment: Equipped creature gets +{X}/+0 and has haste.
Equipped creature has trample and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw a card."
Equipped creature has "Whenever this creature attacks, create a Treasure token."
AuraLand: Enchanted land has "{T}: Add two mana of any one color."
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, create a Treasure token.
Enchanted land untaps during its controller's untap step and an additional time during that step.
